result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian M. Burrows

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
1:43 PM Defendant Brian M. Burrows appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Carl W Knepel appeared by video for Brian M. Burrows.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
INDUCEMENT: Yes
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
The charges in the Information will be the same as the charges in the Criminal Complaint.  Not guilty plea(s).
Further proceedings scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Further proceedings on December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:56 PM Defendant Brian M. Burrows in court.  Attorney Luke K Harrison in court for Brian M. Burrows.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Initial appearance is reset to 10-24-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow public defender more time to appoint counsel.   
Minutes.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:17 pm - Defendant Brian M. Burrows in court.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant still has not signed up with public defender.  He is told to do so immediately.  Initial appearance is reset to 09-19-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.
Initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:41 pm - Defendant Brian M. Burrows in court.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Defendant also has another case scheduled in Br. 3 on 09-12-22.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant requests counsel.   Initial appearance is reset to 08-22-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

2:51 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian M. Burrows in court. Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender. Initial appearance is reset to 07-18-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.

3:08 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian M. Burrows in court. Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess methamphetamine and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-06-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
